Talon;

talon has packed all her stuff and it was alreadye uploaded, she fo=
llowed Lord Perseus while she meditate her situation, she wondered how warm=
 would be Lord elder's welcome




From: Kraftlos 
Sent: Tuesday, August 18=
, 2009 3:02 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Farewell Atlantis

=

  OOC: Many apologies for the delay.

BIC:

"Welome to the team" said Pers=
eus enthusiastically. "I wish we could
be meeting under happier circumstanc=
es."

Just then the AirTankers arrived and landed in the main roadway. It
s=
eemed strange, but with the shuttle port out of comission, this was
the onl=
y viable landing area.

"Everyone, load the gear then hop aboard. We're mov=
ing out." shouted Salveo.

The Maximals began loading the remainder of thei=
r gear into the cargo
shuttles, then one by one they boarded the shuttle.

=
On 8/7/09, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> It would be hard to leave=
 Atlantis. Tucson had found many joys living upon
> the island, most of the=
m finding artifacts that he had collected and tried
> hard to restore. Yet =
they were only material objects, and if not for his
> enjoyment, for the en=
joyment of others to look upon even after his wake.
>
> But he also knew th=
at Lord Perseus was correct. If they stayed any longer,
> it would harm the=
 people. He transforms out of his SUV mode and addresses
> Lord Perseus for=
mally, as taught by his Autobot bretheren. Being blind, he
> pauses for a m=
oment to hear if anyone was around him, to be sure that he had
> not steppe=
d on anyone when he transformed. He then turns his head in Lord
> Perseus's=
 direction.
>
> " Yes your highness, as an Autobot, I promised not only to =
protect but to
> serve faithfully. I will be joining you. "
>
> He also rea=
lized that he had not formally introduced himself to his lord.
>
> " My nam=
e is Tucson, and as I explained earlier, I'm an Autobot, ready and
> willin=
g to serve you faithfully."
>
>
>

 <kraftlos@...> wrote:

said, with a touch of sadness in his voice.

dy to move, my plan is to return to our Maximal
>> brethren and perhaps wor=
k out some sort of cooperation agreement. I fear
>> if

e will only bring more suffering to these people."
>>
>> As he walked acros=
s the bridge toward the group, he noticed a strange
>> face.
>>

re!" he said, addressing Tuscon. "Do you intend to join us?"

aches the tower, Tucson surmises that he no longer needs to

ortant. I better try to get to the
